articles.description: Daniel Ricciardo believes the opening race of the 2020 Formula 1 season could offer “chaos” as drivers return to action following an extending break from racing.
articles.content:
The opening 10 rounds of the season have been called off due to the COVID-19 pandemic, but F1 has targeted a return to racing at the Austrian Grand Prix on July 5. 
Should the race go ahead as plann… [+1620 chars]

articles.author: Michael Gleeson
articles.title: Daw's season in doubt, Daniher's season alive as AFL nears return - The Age
articles.description: Majak Daw's extraordinary comeback to senior football has been halted by a chest injury that threatens to rule him out for the remainder of the abbreviated season, but things are looking brighter for a Bomber on the return trail.
articles.content:
Daniher managed only four games last year and seven the season before while battling groin problems.
Encouragingly for the Bombers, ruckman Tom Bellchambers said Daniher had made an impressive retur… [+3409 chars]

articles.title: Bob Hammond, Hall of Fame SANFL player and coach and AFL administrator, dies aged 78 - ABC News
articles.description: Australian Football Hall of Famer Bob Hammond dies aged 78 in Adelaide yesterday after recently being diagnosed with Parkinson's disease.
articles.content:
The Australian Rules football community is mourning the death of Bob Hammond, who achieved virtually every honour as a player, coach and administrator.
Key points:

articles.author: Tim Elbra
articles.title: NRL players don't listen to education programs, lead 'fake lives', Brad Fittler warns - Wide World of Sports
articles.description: Legend's ugly truth about NRL drug education
articles.content:
Education of NRL players is often a token exercise and awareness lessons really don't sink in, Brad Fittler has warned after the Bronson Xerri drug scandal.
